com.aj.android.commons.view

Class EditTextUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.aj.android.commons.view.EditTextUtils

  • public class EditTextUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Common EditText related utilities from checking for empty EditText and other as validating whether data is within range or not and many others.
    Author:
    Akhil Jain.

    • Method Detail

      • isEditTextEmpty

        public static boolean isEditTextEmpty(EditText editText)
        Checks whether the EditText has any text input or not.
        If the view is null, true is returned.
        Parameters:
        editText - -EditText.
        Returns:
        boolean -true if editText is null or there is no input, else false if text is entered.

      • clearEditText

        Clear the contents of EditText.
        Parameters:
        editText - -EditText.

      • getString

        public static java.lang.String getString(EditText editText)
        Returns String from EditText text.
        If the view component is null, null will be returned.
        Parameters:
        editText - -EditText.
        Returns:
        boolean -String value of edit text, if view is not null.

      • getInteger

        public static java.lang.Integer getInteger(EditText editText)
        Parse the input String text from EditText to Integer.
        If the view component is null or unable to parse the string, null will be returned.
        Parameters:
        editText - -EditText.
        Returns:
        Integer -parsed integer value or null.
        See Also:
        Integer#parseInt(String)}.

      • isEmailValid

        public static boolean isEmailValid(EditText editText)
        Check whether the input text in EditText is valid email or not.
        If the view component is null, false will be returned.
        Parameters:
        editText - -EditText.
        Returns:
        boolean -true if the provided text is valid email, else false.
        See Also:
        StringUtils#isEmailValid(CharSequence)}.

      • isWithinRange

        public static boolean isWithinRange(EditText editText,
                                    long min,
                                    long max)
        Check whether the given input in the within the range of minimum and maximum.
        If the view component is null, false will be returned.
        Parameters:
        editText - -EditText.
        min - -long minimum value.
        max - -long maximum value.
        Returns:
        boolean -returns true if the value is between range, else false.
        See Also:
        #getLong(EditText)}.
